Healthcare Professionals

Canadian healthcare professionals are flocking to digital platforms to receive their information about products and therapeutic areas. Check out some online strategies you can use to engage them.

  • merck connect
  • email marketing
  • third party advertising
  • Webinars and Online Learning
  • banner ads
  • metrics 101
Patients and Consumers
Merck Connect

Merck Connect

Merck Connect is a portal for Canadian healthcare professionals. Customers can learn about Merck products and information about therapeutic areas. The site is a primary customer communication tool for products and therapeutic areas.

Product Sites
What makes a product page successful?

The product pages are branded to a specific product and the microsite should contain important information about the product. Users should not have to review the product monograph or external links to gather more information about the product.

Components of a Merck Connect product site include:

  • Safety Information Popup

  • Home Page

  • Efficacy Data

  • Dosing

  • Resources

  • Access and Reimbursement

Safety Information Popup

High-level fair balance that users have to close in order to view other content on the site. The popup will be the first thing HCPs will see when they land on the page.

X

Home Page

Important high-level information about the product and CTAs that will direct users to the rest of the site. This page should not contain efficacy or dosing information.

X

Efficacy Data

This page showcases important clinical trial information. This page is usually content heavy, so it is best to use tabs to avoid a long scroll.

X

Dosing

Provide recommended dosing information, administration, dosing adjustment and/or patient profiles.

X

Resources

Professional resources, patient tools and external links can be made available on Merck Connect. HCPs can download the resource, or they can link to an order form so hard copies can be shipped to their doctor’s office. 

X

Access and Reimbursement

Provides information about provincial health coverage of the product across the country. This can help encourage a doctor to prescribe the product. Since this page is usually content heavy, we use tabs.

X

see example of product sites

Therapeutic Area Sites
What makes a therapeutic area site successful?

Unbranded websites offer general information about certain conditions or topics, without mentioning brands or products by name.

Components of a therapeutic area page can include:

  • Home Page

  • About

  • Conversation Starters

  • Guidelines

  • Resources

Home Page

Brief overview with information we want to showcase and CTAs that will lead people to different content on the site. 

X

About

Contains information about the therapeutic area. We can use information regarding how many Canadians are affected or why doctors should prescribe drugs to treat the therapeutic area.

X

Conversation Starters

Explanation of how HCPs can talk about the therapeutic area to their patients.

X

Guidelines

Insight into what the external guidelines recommend, especially if the external recommendation indirectly relates to a Merck product.

X

Resources

Unbranded patient or consumer resources and external links can be made available on Merck Connect. HCPs can download the resource, or they can link to an order form so hard copies can be shipped to their office.

X

see example of product sites

Email Marketing

Email Marketing

Email marketing puts your content in the inbox of the HCP. With the right content and segment lists, you have a higher chance of engagement.

Types of Emails: Dosing, Efficacy, Access Coverage, Microsite Page Launch, Campaign Promotion/Launches, Patient Profiles, Formulary Coverage and Patient Resources.

There are two types of emails you can send to Canadian HCPs:
  • Merck Connect Emails
  • Rep Emails

Merck Connect Emails

Merck Connect emails come from the head office. An email about a Merck product or a therapeutic area can be sent to our customers.

  • Audience: Target & non-target HCPs that have expressed consent to receive emails from Merck Canada.
    Through Salesforce Marketing Cloud, segment lists can be created to target specific types of HCPs. Segment lists help put your message in front of the right person.
  • Tone: Corporate & formal.
  • Layout: Elaborate design.
  • Copy: The copy should directly relate to the Call to Action and the copy should be short.
  • CTAs: All head office emails should have a Call to Action. The CTA can link to Merck Connect, product monograph or a third-party site.

With Merck Connect emails, you can make use of marketing automation or email journeys on Salesforce Marketing Cloud.

learn more

Marketing Automation

Automating your email campaign is a great way to take your customers through a funnel. It enables you to turn a string of emails into an effective customer journey. Emails can be triggered according to the way the customer interacts with the previous emails or a website.

Email journeys send emails automatically based on triggers and can be used to keep users engaged.

A well-designed customer journey can transition your customer from one stage of the funnel to the next and re-engage users who have not opened or clicked the call to action in a previous email.

Journey mapping

Before you create a customer journey, you have to map out the journey; this is called customer journey mapping.

A customer journey map is a visualization of the steps your customer will take as they travel through your sales funnel. The purpose of a customer journey map is to ensure that your customers transition from each stage of the journey to keep them engaged.

Rep Emails

Rep emails are sent from Merck Sales Representatives to Canadian healthcare professionals. Reps can select pre-approved content to make emails more personable.

  • Audience: Target HCPs that interact face-to-face with Merck representatives who have expressed consent to receive emails.
  • Tone: Friendly & conversational.
  • Layout: The design is simple and should look similar to a personal email.
  • Copy: The drop-down options in the opening and signoff can help reps make the email more personable. These emails are typically copy heavy.
  • CTAs: The call-to-action can be to Merck Connect, a third-party site or product monograph (when a Merck Connect microsite is not available).
  • Types of Emails: Dosing, Efficacy, Access Coverage, Microsite Page Launch, Campaign Promotion/Launches, Patient Profiles, Formulary Coverage and Patient Resources.
Third-Party Advertising

Third-Party Advertising

Social Network For Physicians

User Audience: Largest audience is the United States (Canada is growing)

Triple Verification: IDology/Experian Identity Verification, AMA/GMC Physician Masterfile, RelevantlD Digital Fingerprinting. 

90% of doctors on platform choose to be anonymous

Demographics: 

  • 70% male, 30% female
  • 15-20 years of practice
  • 35% PCPs, 65% specialists
  • All specialties represented
  • 60% log on via mobile 

Advertising Opportunities:

  • Sponsored Posts
  • Specialty Spotlight Banners
  • Brand Page & Email 
  • Brand Resource Page

Online Global Destination for Physicians and Healthcare Professionals Worldwide

  • News & Perspective: Breaking News, Business of Medicine, Expert Perspective.
  • Drugs & Diseases: Drug Monographs, Disease and Condition Articles, Reference Tools.
  • CME

Advertising Opportunities:

  • Banner Ads 
  • Emails

A Clinical Social Network For Physicians

User Audience:Canada (majority of their members live in Ontario)

Ability to select specialties to target your ads:

  • Family Medicine 10,500
  • Internal Medicine 1,700
  • Endocrinology 184
  • Pain Management 330
  • Psychiatry 1,150

Advertising Opportunities:

  • Brand Page
  • Sponsored Posts
  • Lounge Card
  • Ask Me Anything

Webinars and Online Learning

Webinars and Online Learning

Web-based seminars, or webinars, are a cost-effective digital learning tool that offer easy-to-use, interactive online education. Webinars have the ability to instantly connect users across the world and provide a variety of online learning materials. Webinars, virtual classrooms and online learning modules use a range of different technologies to facilitate communication across users, including live or pre-recorded videos, newsgroup discussions and slide show presentations.

Banner Ads

Banner Ads

With banner ads, you can get your message across to Canadian HCPs. It is important to make sure the message and imagery is consistent with the brand. HCP banner ads are subject to ASC or PAAB review and may require balance depending on the content.

Banner ads best practices
  • Keep It Simple

    banner ad sizes are small and too much information can be overwhelming, confusing and difficult to read. Keep your messaging, imagery and call-to-actions (CTAs) as clear and simple as possible.

  • High Quality Assets

    use high-quality imagery, legible typefaces and brand elements, while remaining under the 150kb file limit used by Google Ads. Assets that are clear and crisp have a higher engagement levels. 

  • Understand Your Audience

    display ads should be targeted and relevant. Understand your audience and tailor the content for them.

  • Stick to the Brand

    whether the ads are branded or unbranded, all of the imagery, colours and messaging should be consistent with the brand.

Metrics 101

Metrics 101

Reach, Engage, Convert
  • Reach: used as a measure of success for a brand awareness campaign. Reach is found at the top of the marketing funnel. Reach is the number of people who have seen your ads at least once.
  • Engage: used for measuring the consideration phase and often measured by users interacting with the ads. For some campaigns, this could include clicks to a website, commenting on a post or liking a page. Levels of engagement on the site can be measured to evaluate site visitors with intent to potentially convert. This could include time on page, number of pages visited or video views. 
  • Convert: conversion is a completed activity that is important to the success of the campaign. Conversions track how many visitors completed the activity on the site (for example, downloaded a PDF or watched a video).
Website

Track insights about the website that can help you make future decisions. Things that can be tracked are:

  • Users: total number of unique devices
  • Sessions: total number of website visits
  • Page Views: total number of pages viewed
  • Average Sessions: the amount of time users spend on a website on average
  • Goal/Conversion: the desired interaction or activity on a website
  • Bounce: single page website visits with no interaction with the page
  • Bounce Rate: the percentage of bounces
Ad Metrics
  • Reach: the number of people who have seen your ads at least once. Reach is different from impressions.
  • Impressions: the number of times your ads were shown to people. 
  • Clicks: how many users clicked on a link in the ad.  
  • Cost Per Click (CPC): the average cost for a click. Calculated by dividing total spend by clicks.  
  • Click Through Rate (CTR): the percentage of clicks from the ads. The higher the CTR, the more engaged your audience was with your ad.  
  • Cost Per Thousand Impressions (CPM): the average cost to achieve 1,000 impressions (typically used to calculate success of a brand awareness campaign).  
  • Engagement: how the user interacts with the ad (such as likes, shares, comments, reactions)  
  • Engagement Rate: is the percentage of engagements received for the total impressions received.
